title: (x) Optima-like "The New West" - Stettler {Mark S}
content:
I’m looking for a variation on what I presume to be Optima, an example of which I’ve attached.

Compared to the LinoType Optima example if found online, the differences I immediately pick out are:  
a squatter, rounder ’S’, and wider, elongated horizontal strokes in the ’E’.

Can anyone help me solve this one?

Thanks.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Optima\_original.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225122048/http:/typophile.com/files/Optima_original.jpg) | 60.56 KB |

 [‹ is this a hand drawn logo or a typeface](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225122048/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34758 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Ultimate" tall narrow Art Deco sans - various alternatives {gang} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225122048/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34765 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Daisy Lumley

comments.content:
This is definitely not Optima. I think I’ve seen this before, probably in a pre-digital format.

- Lex

Yes, with it’s ’70s style and soft edges, this looks like it came from the phototype era.

You might like [Alexon](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225122048/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/red_rooster/alexon/), [Radiant](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225122048/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/red_rooster/radiant/), or [URW Linear](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225122048/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/urw/urw_linear_wide/).
It’s an old film font called Stettler. Can’t find much info about it other than a short one-line specimen in an old catalog (no full alphabet showings).

Here is some information about Stettler that might help:

[http://www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=55494](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225122048/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=55494 "http://www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=55494")
